lines.content: * Deadline is a type of Task.
* Deadlines have a 'by' field to indicate the period which the task must be completed by.
* Constructor that takes in the name of the Task alongside some timing details.
* By default, a Tasks is not completed.
* @param task_name The name of this Task
* @param by A string representation of the end date/time of this Task
* @return The name of this task and the deadline details.

* Prints standard goodby message and closes DIO.
dio.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Mother of all Exceptions for duke
* Constructor to pass on forward to Exception
* @param msg Message to pass to Exception
private final static String OOPS = "☹ OOPS!!!";
public static class Missing extends DukeException {
* Constructor to pass on forward to Exception
* @param msg Message to pass to Exception
public static class Description extends Missing {
* Description for particular Task type is missing.
* Missing [Description] will lead to this error message.
* @param taskType Name of the task type where this error occurs
super(String.format("%s Missing description for %s", OOPS, taskType));
public static class Parameter extends Missing {
* Missing [Parameter] will lead to this error message.
super(String.format("%s Missing parameter(s) for %s", OOPS, taskType));
public static class Options extends Missing {
* Missing `/by` will lead to this error message.
super(String.format("%s Missing or incomplete options(s) for %s", OOPS, taskType));
public static class Invalid extends DukeException {
* Constructor to pass on forward to Exception
* @param msg Message to pass to Exception
public static class Index extends Invalid {
* Index is out of bound for particular collection.
* User tries to delete entry `9` when the task list is empty.
super(String.format("%s The list does not contain index %d", OOPS, ind));
public static class Input extends Invalid {
* Generic exception handler for any Invalid Inputs.
* @param msg The message to be passed to Exception
public static class Command extends Invalid {
* User supplied command does not exist.
super(String.format("%s I'm sorry, but I don't know what you just said means :-(", OOPS));
public static class Unimplemented extends DukeException {
* Constructor to pass on forward to Exception
super("Apologise the command you just typed has not available yet.");

throw new DukeException.Invalid.Input(String.format("%s is not an integer", userInSplit[1]));

throw new DukeException.Invalid.Input("Multiple `/from` detected, only one is allowed, please try again.");
throw new DukeException.Invalid.Input("Multiple `/to` detected, only one is allowed, please try again.");
return new String[]{ fromSplit[0].trim() , toSplit[0].trim(), toSplit[1].trim() };
throw new DukeException.Invalid.Input("Multiple `/by` detected, only one is allowed, please try again.");
throw new DukeException.Invalid.Input("DIO - extractTaskParams - used unexpectedly");
* Event is a type of Task.
* Events have a 'from' and 'to' field to indicate the period which the task takes place.
* Constructor that takes in the name of the Task alongside with other timing details.
* @param task_name The name of this Task
* @param from A string representation of the start date/time of this Task
* @param to A string representation of the end date/time of this Task
public Event(String task_name, String from, String to) {
* Returns String representation of an Event.
* @return The name of this task and the from and to details.
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s , to: %s)", super.toString(), this.from, this.to);
* Task is the superclass of the activities that can be stored within Duke.
* Creates a Task with the provided Task Name.
* By default, created Tasks are marked as incomplete.
* @param task_name The name of the uncompleted Task.
* Returns the state of the task alongside with the task name.
* > `[X] read book` would mean that the task `read book` is complete.
* > `[ ] read book` would mean that the task `read book` is incomplete.
* @return A string representation of this task and it's state.
* TaskMaster is the managing class for all Tasks.
dio.println("Oh my, the list is empty!");
dio.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
dio.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", ll.size()));
